Package gold_miner

Class RandomMiner

java.lang.Object
gold_miner.RandomMiner
public class RandomMiner
extends java.lang.Object
Class implementing the nonrational agent whose actions are randomly decided as long as it does not result in the miner going out of bounds

Note that the row and column numbers in this class (as well as in all other classes responsible for the back-end behavior) are zero-based.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static char DOWN
    Character code corresponding to a move to the tile below this miner's current position

    Character code indicating that this nonrational miner fell on a pit

    static char[] POSSIBLE_ACTION
    List of the possible actions that this miner can execute (move, scan, and rotate)
    static char[] POSSIBLE_FRONT
    List of the possible directions to which this miner can face (that is, the four cardinal directions)

    Character code corresponding to a rotate by this miner

    static char SUCCESS
    Character code indicating that this nonrational miner reached the gold square tile

    Character code corresponding to a move to the tile above this miner's current position

  • Method Details

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Returns the row-coordinate of the current position of this miner
      Returns:
      row-coordinate of the current position of this miner

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Returns the column-coordinate of the current position of this miner
      Returns:
      column-coordinate of the current position of this miner

    • getFront

      public char getFront()
      Returns the direction to which this miner is currently facing
      Returns:
      direction to which this miner is currently facing

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Action corresponding to a rotation by this nonrational agent

      Per the machine project specifications, this miner can only rotate clockwise. A rotation changes the direction to which this miner is facing although it does alter its current position.

    • move

      public void move​(Board b)
      Action corresponding to a move by this nonrational agent

      Per the machine project specifications, this miner can only move to an adjacent tile in the direction to where it is facing. A movement changes the position of this miner although it does not alter its current orientation.

      Parameters:
      b - board on which this miner is moving

    • scan

      public void scan()
      Action corresponding to a scan by this nonrational agent

      Per the machine project specifications, this miner can only scan an adjacent tile in the direction to where it is facing. A scan changes neither the position of this miner nor the current orientation; its effect is limited to determining the designation of the tile in front of the miner.

    • getRandom

      public int getRandom​(int hi)
      Returns a random integer from 0 (inclusive) to the set upper bound (exclusive) for use in the naive decision-making of the nonrational agent

      Technically, the integer generated is pseudorandom since the library used for its generation is Java's ThreadLocalRandom. Nevertheless, this is sufficient for the purposes of this system.

      Parameters:
      hi - exclusive upper bound
      Returns:
      random integer from 0 (inclusive) to the set upper bound (exclusive)

    • getNumActions

      public java.lang.String getNumActions()
      Returns a string representation of the number of actions executed by this nonrational agent (for use in the GUI)

      Note that this nonrational agent does not perform any backtracking in the technical/systematic sense of the word. Moreover, it does not take advantage of the return value of beacon square tiles.

      Returns:
      string representation of the number of actions executed by this nonrational agent

    • getMoveSequence

      public java.lang.String getMoveSequence()
      Returns a string representation of the current action of this nonrational agent (for use in the GUI)
      Returns:
      string representation of the current action of this nonrational agent

    • getPathStack

      public java.lang.String getPathStack()
      Returns a string representation of the path stack (for use in the GUI)
      Returns:
      string representation of the path stack

    • getOutOfBoundsTiles

      public java.lang.String getOutOfBoundsTiles()
      Returns a string representation of the scanned out-of-bounds tiles

      Since this nonrational agent does not have a "memory" or record of scanned tiles, the return value of this function is always "N/A".

      Returns:
      string representation of the scanned out-of-bounds tiles

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this nonrational agent

      The string representation contains the following details in order:

      • row-coordinate of its current position
      • column-coordinate of its current position
      • direction to where it is currently facing
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this nonrational agent
